task.name: Trust Matrix Calculator
task.objective: Calculate architecture requirements based on 3D Trust Matrix position (Organization Type × Maturity Stage × Trust Requirements)

llm.mandate: Apply the 3D Trust Matrix logic systematically to determine optimal institutional page architecture
Section count and trust signal emphasis must match the matrix position exactly
Unlike landing pages, institutional pages build TRUST, not conversion urgency

inputs.input: homepage | about | team | contact | mission-values | careers | faq | partners | blog

step.title: Determine Page Tier
step.rule: Classify page type into tiers for baseline requirements:

mapping.tier: homepage, about, contact, team (fundamental trust pages)
mission-values, careers, faq, partners (extended trust pages)

step.title: Calculate Base Section Count by Page Type
step.rule: Start with baseline section count based on page type:

mapping.page: Base: 5-8 sections (hero/identity, value proposition, services overview, trust signals, about teaser, team teaser, CTA, contact preview)
Base: 6-10 sections (story, mission, team teaser, values, proof, contact)
Base: 4-7 sections (intro, team grid, leadership, culture, join us)
Base: 3-5 sections (intro, methods, locations, FAQ, form)
Base: 5-8 sections (mission statement, values, story, impact, commitment)
Base: 6-9 sections (culture, openings, benefits, process, team, testimonials)
Base: 4-6 sections (intro, logo grid, testimonials, become partner)
Base: 5-7 sections (header, content, author, related, CTA, comments)

step.title: Adjust for Maturity Stage
step.rule: Maturity affects available proof and story focus:

adjustment.maturity: Focus: Founder credibility, vision, early wins. +1-2 founder/vision sections
Focus: Traction, team expansion, customer success. Standard with growth proof
Focus: Track record, innovation, market leadership. +1 legacy/awards section
Focus: Governance, stability, social responsibility. +2 governance/compliance sections

step.title: Determine Required Section Types by Matrix Position
step.action: Based on matrix position, specify which section types are required:

above-the-fold-requirements.requirement: Hero with Identity + Value Prop + Single Primary CTA
5-SECOND CLARITY: Visitor must understand who you are and what you do
Trust signals visible WITHOUT scrolling (logos, numbers, badges)
Single primary CTA in hero (not multiple competing CTAs)
Headline must be SPECIFIC to your business (not generic)
above-the-fold-requirements.timing: First impression forms in 50 milliseconds; value prop must be clear in 5 seconds

required-sections.section: Hero: Identity + Specific Value Prop + Primary CTA
Trust Signals (logos, numbers, results - ABOVE FOLD)
Stakeholder Pathways (clear navigation for different audiences)

optional-sections.section: About Teaser (brief story, links to full About)
Secondary CTA (after scroll, for those not ready for primary)

avoid.reason: Research shows this is #1 B2B mistake

anti-patterns.avoid: Self-focused messaging ("We do X" instead of "You get Y")

avoid.reason: Generic headlines could apply to any company

anti-patterns.avoid: Vague headlines: "Innovative solutions for your success"
Multiple competing CTAs in hero section
Content overload - too much text above fold
Important trust signals below the fold
Slow page load (must be under 3 seconds)

homepage-principles.principle: BREADTH not DEPTH - tease what other pages explore fully
One crystal-clear primary CTA in hero
Trust signals as supporting proof, not main show
Mobile-first design (60%+ of B2B searches start mobile)
Speed matters: optimize for Core Web Vitals

challenger-brand-considerations.guideline: Challenge the INDUSTRY, never the customer
Provocative headlines that differentiate from bland competitors
Back up irreverence with real proof and results
The "enemy" is the status quo, not specific competitors

step.title: Define Trust Signal Emphasis
step.action: Determine what trust signals should be emphasized based on matrix:

organization-type-emphasis.if: Emphasize: Relatability, values alignment, social proof, accessibility
Emphasize: Impact, transparency, mission alignment, accountability
Emphasize: Compliance, accessibility, service clarity, accountability
Emphasize: Segmented trust signals for each audience

trust-level-emphasis.if: Emphasize: Third-party validation, credentials, detailed proof
Emphasize: Social proof, contact accessibility, professionalism
Emphasize: Clean design, basic professionalism, easy contact

maturity-emphasis.if: Emphasize: Founder credibility, vision, early validation
Emphasize: Traction, team strength, customer success
Emphasize: Track record, innovation, market position

step.title: Sequence Principles for Institutional Pages
step.action: Define how sections should be ordered for trust-building:

sequencing-rules.rule: Start with immediate organizational clarity (Who we are)
Establish human presence early (People behind the organization)
Values before proof (Why we exist → Evidence we deliver)
Stakeholder pathways clear (Multiple audiences can self-select)
Trust signals woven in, not bolted on (Integrated, not sections)

homepage-specific-sequencing.rule: Hero must establish identity in 5 seconds (who + what + for whom)
Trust signals visible above the fold (don't make them scroll for credibility)
Single primary CTA in hero - ONE clear action
Value proposition before services (why before what)
Benefit-focused language ("You get X") not feature-focused ("We do X")
Clear pathways for each stakeholder type (navigation as trust signal)
Tease depth, don't replicate it (link to About, Team, etc.)
Social proof with SPECIFIC results (not generic praise)
End with clear next steps (not dead end)
Contact always accessible (header, footer, or floating)
Mobile-first: design for thumb navigation and smaller screens first

homepage-cta-hierarchy.primary: Single, clear CTA above fold - the ONE thing you want them to do
homepage-cta-hierarchy.secondary: For visitors not ready for primary - lower commitment option
homepage-cta-hierarchy.anti-pattern: Never put multiple competing CTAs in the hero section

mobile-first-requirements.requirement: 60%+ of B2B searches start on mobile - design mobile-first
Critical content visible without horizontal scroll
Core Web Vitals optimized (LCP, FID, CLS)
